title: ScamViruS
author: ScamViruS
content: What happened: Arkham fake airdrop website..  Website :  Code:https://arkhamfinance.pro/airdrop/Twitter : https://twitter.com/AmaraPenAISince Arkham arrived on the Binance launchpad, scammers have been using the project's name to scam crypto users. Twitter has now become the easiest medium for scammers to promote these fake websites. This Twitter account has a good amount of followers and the reach of its tweets also good, which can be guessed just by looking at its tweets. This is a completely fake website, Newbies please don't connect your wallet to this website, they will steal your wallet information. Control your greed and avoid sending your wallet information to scammers, stay safe from hackers.QuoteDomain Name: arkhamfinance.proRegistry Domain ID: a6f010121e24437fbbcbcb2cc72e51b9-DONUTSRegistrar WHOIS Server: http://www.hostinger.comRegistrar URL: http://www.hostinger.comUpdated Date: 2023-07-25T07:17:56ZCreation Date: 2023-07-25T07:17:54ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2024-07-25T07:17:54ZRegistrar: HOSTINGER operations, UABRegistrar IANA ID: 1636Registrar Abuse Contact Email: email@hostinger.comRegistrar Abuse Contact Phone: +1.11

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Do I calls it airdrops mongers or hunters are likely to fall cheaply as they always want some free tokens from airdrop. It's quite unfortunate that twitter has now become the center for scammers and what if Elon Musk implemented the payment system on the twitter, doesn't it mean it would go worst than this? This side of the board are meant for newbies to be visiting since they always focused their efforts on getting free tokens.Anyway thanks for sharing.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Twitter has always been the social network that pulls in the most crypto talk, and newbies go there to get crypto news and updates. And right now, Elon Musk has made things very easy for scammers, as they can now get the blue ticker by just paying 8 dollars. There is no need for some verification and all those checks, which makes the account look more real and less suspicious with the fake followers, which might have possibly been boosted by bots or any other means necessary. ScamViruS, I know this is about scams, which makes this place the perfect board for them, but I seriously doubt this information will serve its purpose well on this board. As the highest percentage of newbies are always active in the beginners and help sections, My suggestion would have been for this topic to be in the beginners and help section for a little while before you could move it back to this place. Just my suggestion, though.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: you found this scam site the same day it was created, these scammers are good at marketing and know how to reach victims.I report it to hostinger https://www.hostinger.com/report-abuse please do the same.Quote from: Nwada001 on July 25, 2023, 11:46:04 PMTwitter has always been the social network that pulls in the most crypto talk, and newbies go there to get crypto news and updates. And right now, Elon Musk has made things very easy for scammers, as they can now get the blue ticker by just paying 8 dollars. There is no need for some verification and all those checks, which makes the account look more real and less suspicious with the fake followers, which might have possibly been boosted by bots or any other means necessary.This service is supposed to do the opposite, as reporting that this user supports scam leads to the freezing of the banking service that he used to pay Twitter Blue.https://business.twitter.com/en/help/account-setup/billing-basics.htmlRecognizing such accounts is easy compared to famous accounts with millions of followers, which seem to be easy to hack.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: ScamViruS on July 25, 2023, 08:53:20 PMSince Arkham arrived on the Binance launchpad, scammers have been using the project's name to scam crypto users. Twitter has now become the easiest medium for scammers to promote these fake websites. This Twitter account has a good amount of followers and the reach of its tweets also good, which can be guessed just by looking at its tweets. This is a completely fake website, Newbies please don't connect your wallet to this website, they will steal your wallet information. Control your greed and avoid sending your wallet information to scammers, stay safe from hackers.This is one phishing site among the thousands of domains that occupied the hashtag #AEKM on Twitter after the Binance news. It is worth noting that ARKHAM is not the only project that scammers set eyes on its community to defraud them. Still, you will find that most of the currencies that rise in the trends are due to an event or some hot news; you find a lot of tweets about fake airdrops or giveaways around them. However, I am sure that these traps for scammers have become common, but awareness must be raised among new users and investors and help report to suspend these domains; perhaps someone will fall into them as a result of their lack of knowledge.The phishing domain has been reported successfully, thank you, OP.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.created_time: July 26, 2023, 09:58:28 PMLast edit: July 26, 2023, 10:10:27 PM by JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: Adbitco on July 25, 2023, 10:52:02 PMIt's quite unfortunate that twitter has now become the center for scammers and what if Elon Musk implemented the payment system on the twitter, doesn't it mean it would go worst than this?As long as they continue to working swiftly on phishing and scam sites/accounts. Things will continue being bad. I wish these platforms could react swiftly to a reported scam account like they did to those reported for posting nude photos, or racial slurs. This world would be a better place.Luckily, those who have Metamask and coinbase wallet extensions are already getting warnings

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on July 26, 2023, 09:58:28 PMQuote from: Adbitco on July 25, 2023, 10:52:02 PMIt's quite unfortunate that twitter has now become the center for scammers and what if Elon Musk implemented the payment system on the twitter, doesn't it mean it would go worst than this?As long as they continue to working swiftly on phishing and scam sites/accounts. Things will continue being bad. I wish these platforms could react swiftly to a reported scam account like they did to those reported for posting nude photos, or racial slurs. This world would be a better place.Luckily, those who have Metamask and coinbase wallet extensions are already getting warnings At least to limits their chances of being scammed and got phished, any platform that always gives warning to while connecting their wallet to have it in that is a very risky place to deal with and if such person is a newbie and never pay heed to the warning then are likely to lose their asset with just a simple clicked that's why today someone of the beginners fails to make enquiry over here before hastily rush to join most of those airdrop that always results losing one asset.
